oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-05-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 14, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer), guest performers Flatt & Scruggs, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1075th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Archie Campbell; Ray Price; Flatt & Scruggs; Del Wood; George Morgan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George Morgan introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Archie Campbell) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Ray Price) (recording) -- George Morgan introduces Flatt & Scruggs -- If I Should Wander Back Tonight (Flatt & Scruggs) -- Grant Turner introduces Del Wood -- Are You From Dixie (Del Wood) -- Grant Turner and George Morgan talk -- Who Knows You The Best (George Morgan) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (George Morgan) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Selph, Jimmy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Pruett, Jack; Flatt, Lester; Scruggs, Earl; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Wiggins, Roy; Wilson, Smiley
